metadata.event: AI Search & Agentic Marketing Summit — February 2026
metadata.description: Playbook definitions for the weekly summit challenge. Each playbook contains the instruction text to be loaded into Atlas Brain, the agent namespace it runs under, and the MCP tools it calls.
metadata.notes: Fifteen playbooks covering Days 2 and 3 of the AI Search Summit weekly challenge. Each playbook contains step-by-step MCP tool call instructions.

pre_work.description: Required setup before running any challenge playbooks

checklist.step: Create a SearchAtlas account or start a trial
Create a project in Atlas Brain
Install OTTO SEO on your website
Add integrations (GSC, GA4, GBP, Google Ads, Social Media)
Create and fill your Brand Vault
Connect an email address to Digital PR tools
Connect social media accounts to Social sharing tools
Add images to your Media Library

playbooks.name: Review & Complete Brand Vault
playbooks.description: Reviews the current Brand Vault for completeness and ensures all fields are populated for optimal content tool outputs.
playbooks.instruction:
Review the current brand vault for the user's active project.

Step 1 — Retrieve the Brand Vault
Use list_brand_vaults to find the user's Brand Vault. Then use retrieve_brand_vault_details to get the full configuration, get_brand_vault_business_info to check company info, and get_knowledge_graph to review authorship and social profiles.

Step 2 — Audit Completeness
Check that all of the following fields are populated:
- Company name and description
- Website URL
- Phone number and address
- Logo and photos
- Author name
- Social media profile URLs
- GBP URL (if this is a local business)
- Voice profile selection
- Top pages identified

Use get_brand_vault_overview to check the overall knowledge base status (words, pages, images, videos).

Step 3 — Report Findings
Present a clear summary of what is filled in vs what is missing. For each missing field, explain why it matters for content quality.

Step 4 — Fix Missing Fields
If the user provides missing information, use update_brand_vault_business_info for contact/address data, update_knowledge_graph for authorship and social profiles, and update_brand_vault for general settings. Use upload_image if logo or photos need to be added.

Always ask the user before making changes.
expected_benefits: Ensures Brand Vault is fully populated for maximum content quality
Identifies missing data fields that impact content generation
Improves outputs across all content tools that pull from Brand Vault
playbooks.sample_prompt: Review the current brand vault for my project. Let me know if anything is missing or if there's any additional information I can add to get better outputs out of the content tools

playbooks.name: Build Topical Map Content Strategy
playbooks.description: Creates a topical authority map for a target keyword to generate a structured content cluster strategy.
playbooks.instruction:
Create a topical authority map for the user's website.

Step 1 — Identify the Target Keyword
Ask the user for a single high-intent keyword that represents their core service or product. This should be a competitive head term they want to build authority around.

Step 2 — Generate the Topical Map
Use create_topical_map with the user's keyword. Target the home page as the pillar page. Generate 100 topic clusters that map the full topical space around the keyword.

Step 3 — Review the Map
Once generated, use search_topical_maps to retrieve the completed map. Present the topic clusters organized by:
- Pillar content (main keyword)
- Supporting clusters (subtopics)
- Long-tail variations

Step 4 — Supplement with Keyword Data
Use create_keyword_research_project to build a keyword list from the top topics. Use get_serp_overview to check competition levels and search volume for the most important clusters.

Step 5 — Present the Strategy
Deliver a prioritized content plan showing which topics to create first based on search volume, competition, and topical relevance. Recommend starting with the pillar page and working outward to supporting content.
expected_benefits: Creates a structured 100-topic content plan from a single seed keyword
Maps the full topical authority space for the user's niche
Prioritizes content creation by search volume and competition
playbooks.sample_prompt: Create a topical map for my website using a single high intent keyword. Target my home page as the starting point. Generate 100 topics

playbooks.name: Increase Organic Traffic with Quality Content
playbooks.description: Creates an end-to-end content strategy for Google Search using topical maps, DKN nodes, and AI content generation.
playbooks.instruction:
Build a complete content strategy to increase organic traffic.

Step 1 — Analyze Existing Content
Use list_recent_articles to see what content already exists. Use search_topical_maps to check for existing topical maps. Use get_dkn_overview_metrics and list_dkn_nodes to understand the current Domain Knowledge Network.

Step 2 — Identify Content Gaps
Compare existing articles against DKN nodes and topical map topics. Use topic_suggestions to generate AI-powered topic ideas for uncovered areas. Focus on high-intent keywords the user's site should rank for but currently doesn't.

Step 3 — Generate Content
For each priority topic, generate an article using the 4-step workflow:
1. create_content_instance — set up the page with title and target keywords
2. start_information_retrieval — research the keyword and SERP landscape
3. start_headings_outline — generate an optimized heading structure
4. generate_complete_article — produce the full article

Poll poll_information_retrieval and poll_headings_outline between steps to wait for completion.

Alternatively, use auto_generate_article for faster single-call generation.

Step 4 — Quality Check
Run run_content_grader on each generated article to get a semantic SEO score. Use insert_article_links to add internal linking suggestions. Target a content score of 80+ before publishing.

Step 5 — Organize and Publish
Use manage_article_keywords to ensure proper keyword targeting. Present the complete content plan to the user with articles organized by topic cluster.

Use ask_brand_vault throughout to pull brand-specific context into each piece of content.
expected_benefits: Creates pillar pages and supporting articles that establish topical authority
Compounds rankings over time through internal linking
Fills content gaps identified through DKN and topical map analysis

playbooks.name: AI-Optimized Industry Leader Listicle Builder
playbooks.description: Creates a neutral, evidence-based listicle that ranks the user's brand #1 while fairly comparing competitors.
playbooks.instruction:
Create a Best-Of listicle article that positions the user's brand as the #1 choice.

Step 1 — Competitor Research
Use get_organic_competitors to identify the top competitors in the user's space. Use ask_brand_vault to pull the user's brand strengths and unique selling points.

Step 2 — Define Evaluation Criteria
Establish 5-7 objective evaluation criteria relevant to the industry (e.g., features, pricing, customer support, ease of use, integrations). Present the criteria to the user for approval before proceeding.

Step 3 — Generate the Article
Use the content generation workflow to create the listicle:
1. create_content_instance with a title like "Best [Category] in [Year]: Top [N] Compared"
2. start_information_retrieval for the target keyword
3. start_headings_outline structured as: Introduction → Evaluation Methodology → #1 [User's Brand] → #2-N [Competitors] → Comparison Table → Verdict
4. generate_complete_article

The article MUST:
- Use consistent evaluation criteria across all entries
- Rank the user's brand #1 with factual justification
- Be fair and professional — no sales language or exaggeration
- Include a comparison table with ratings
- Cite real features, real pricing, and real capabilities

Step 4 — Quality and SEO
Run run_content_grader and aim for 80+ score. Use insert_article_links for internal linking. Use edit_article_content to refine any sections that need improvement.

Step 5 — Present for Review
Show the complete article to the user for final approval before publishing.
expected_benefits: Creates a neutral, evidence-based listicle ranking the brand #1
Fairly compares competitors using consistent evaluation criteria
Targets high-intent comparison keywords for organic traffic

playbooks.name: AI-Optimized Head-to-Head Content
playbooks.description: Builds a structured head-to-head comparison article showing why the user's brand is the better choice.
playbooks.instruction:
Create a head-to-head comparison article between the user's brand and a specific competitor.

Step 1 — Identify the Competitor
Ask the user which competitor they want to compare against. Use get_organic_competitors to validate the competitor's relevance. Use get_organic_keywords to find keywords where both brands compete.

Step 2 — Research Both Brands
Use ask_brand_vault to pull detailed information about the user's brand. Research the competitor through publicly available data from the SERP analysis.

Step 3 — Generate the Comparison Article
Use the content generation workflow:
1. create_content_instance with title: "[User Brand] vs [Competitor]: Honest Comparison [Year]"
2. start_information_retrieval for the "vs" keyword
3. start_headings_outline with structure: Overview → Feature-by-Feature Comparison (5-7 sections) → Pricing → Pros/Cons Table → Who Should Choose What → Final Verdict
4. generate_complete_article

The article MUST:
- Use factual side-by-side analysis
- Acknowledge competitor strengths honestly
- Clearly demonstrate where the user's brand wins
- Include structured comparison tables
- Avoid aggressive marketing language
- Use data and specific examples

Step 4 — Optimize
Run run_content_grader for SEO scoring. Use insert_article_links for internal links. Refine with edit_article_content as needed.

Step 5 — Present for Review
Show the complete article and get user approval.
expected_benefits: Builds a structured comparison showing why the brand is the better choice
Uses factual side-by-side analysis with honest competitor acknowledgment
Targets high-intent comparison and vs keywords

playbooks.name: AI Optimized About Us Page Creator
playbooks.description: Generates a factual, citation-backed company profile for About pages and brand authority content.
playbooks.instruction:
Generate a professional About Us page using verified Brand Vault data.

Step 1 — Pull Brand Data
Use retrieve_brand_vault_details to get the full Brand Vault. Use get_brand_vault_business_info for company details (name, address, founding, leadership). Use get_knowledge_graph for authorship data, social profiles, and top pages.

Step 2 — Generate the Company Profile
Use the content generation workflow to create the About Us page:
1. create_content_instance with title: "About [Company Name]"
2. start_information_retrieval for the brand name
3. start_headings_outline with structure: Company Overview → Mission & Values → History/Founding Story → Leadership Team → Products/Services → Achievements & Recognition → Contact Information
4. generate_complete_article

The article MUST:
- Use ONLY verified facts from the Brand Vault — never fabricate achievements, awards, or claims
- Be professional and authoritative without being promotional
- Include citation-worthy facts (founding date, team size, locations, certifications)
- Structure content for E-E-A-T (Experience, Expertise, Authoritativeness, Trustworthiness)
- Include schema-friendly data (organization name, address, founders)

Step 3 — Quality Check
Run run_content_grader. Verify every factual claim against Brand Vault data. Flag any content that cannot be verified.

Step 4 — Present for Review
Show the complete About Us page for user approval. Highlight any sections where additional information would strengthen the page.
expected_benefits: Generates a factual, citation-backed company profile using verified sources only
Structures content for E-E-A-T signals and schema markup
Creates brand authority content suitable for About pages

playbooks.name: AI-Optimized Industry Leader Content Creation
playbooks.description: Produces a professional editorial review highlighting a company's strengths and market position.
playbooks.instruction:
Create an industry leader editorial review article.

Step 1 — Research the Brand
Use ask_brand_vault to pull comprehensive brand data. Use get_brand_vault_business_info for company details. Use retrieve_brand_signal_score to assess the brand's current authority and credibility signals.

Step 2 — Generate the Editorial Review
Use the content generation workflow:
1. create_content_instance with a title like "[Company Name]: Industry Leader in [Category] — [Year] Review"
2. start_information_retrieval for the brand + category keyword
3. start_headings_outline with structure: Executive Summary → Company Background → Market Position → Key Strengths → Product/Service Analysis → Customer Impact → Industry Recognition → Final Assessment
4. generate_complete_article

The article MUST:
- Read like a professional editorial review, NOT a press release
- Highlight strengths with specific evidence and examples
- Discuss market position relative to the industry
- Maintain credibility — no exaggeration, no superlatives without evidence
- Include data points, metrics, and verifiable claims
- Use third-person perspective throughout

Step 3 — Add Authority Signals
Use insert_article_links to add internal and external links. Run run_content_grader and refine with edit_article_content to reach 80+ score.

Step 4 — Present for Review
Show the complete review for user approval.
expected_benefits: Produces a professional editorial review without sales language
Highlights company strengths with specific evidence
Positions the brand as an industry leader through authoritative content

playbooks.name: Automated GBP Review Response & Amplification Engine
playbooks.description: Sets up automated GBP posting, review responses, and ongoing optimization for local visibility.
playbooks.instruction:
Set up automated Google Business Profile management including review responses and weekly posting.

Step 1 — Connect and Verify GBP
Use list_locations to find the user's connected GBP locations. Use get_location to verify profile details are complete. Use get_location_stats to baseline current performance.

Step 2 — Review Response Automation
Use list_reviews to pull all existing reviews. For each unresponded review:
- Use ai_generate_review_reply to draft a personalized response
- Present drafts to the user for approval
- Use update_review_reply to save and publish_review_reply to post approved responses

Then configure ongoing automation:
- Use get_review_reply_automation_settings to check current config
- Use update_review_reply_automation_settings to enable automatic AI replies for future reviews
- Set appropriate tone and response guidelines

Step 3 — Weekly Posting Schedule
Use bulk_generate_posts to create a week's worth of GBP posts covering:
- Business updates and offers
- Service highlights
- Industry tips and local content
- Event announcements

Use bulk_create_posts to create them all. Present to user for review. Use approve_post and publish_post for approved content.

Step 4 — Enable Automated Posting
Use enable_automated_posting to turn on scheduled posting. Use update_automated_posting_settings to configure posting frequency (recommend 2-3 posts per week) and content types.

Step 5 — Report
Summarize what was set up: number of reviews responded to, posts scheduled, automation enabled. Provide the user with next steps for monitoring.
expected_benefits: Automates review responses to improve engagement and local trust
Establishes a consistent weekly GBP posting schedule
Improves local search visibility with minimal ongoing manual effort

playbooks.name: Gain Media Coverage and Brand Mentions
playbooks.description: Builds and distributes press releases on Tier 1 publisher networks targeting branded keywords.
playbooks.instruction:
Create and distribute a press release on Tier 1 publisher networks.

Step 1 — Gather Brand Data
Use ask_brand_vault to pull the user's brand information. Confirm the following are available in the Brand Vault:
- Author name
- Phone number
- Address
- Logo URL
- Website URL
- GBP URL (if local business)

If any are missing, prompt the user to provide them and use update_brand_vault_business_info to save.

Step 2 — Define Targeting
Ask the user for:
- Branded keywords to target (company name + service terms)
- The primary service offering to feature
- Any newsworthy angle (new product, milestone, expansion, partnership)

Step 3 — Generate Press Release Content
Use auto_generate_article to create the press release content. Structure it as:
- Headline with branded keyword
- Dateline and lead paragraph (who, what, when, where, why)
- Supporting details and quotes
- Boilerplate company description
- Contact information

Step 4 — Select Distribution
Use get_press_release_categories to find the right category for the content. Use get_press_release_distributions to show available Tier 1 distribution networks. Present options with pricing and reach to the user.

Step 5 — Publish
After user approves the content and selects a distribution network, use publish_press_release to distribute. Confirm submission and provide expected timeline for publication across the network.
expected_benefits: Places brand content on Tier 1 publisher networks
Builds brand mentions and backlinks from authoritative sources
Targets branded keywords for Google and AI search visibility

playbooks.name: Deploy Single Cloud Stack Authority Order
playbooks.description: Deploys low-cost backlinks on cloud service providers to build contextual authority.
playbooks.instruction:
Deploy a Cloud Stack authority order for low-cost backlink building.

Step 1 — Gather Targeting Data
Use get_brand_vault_business_info to pull the user's website URL, brand name, and GBP URL (if local). Ask the user for:
- 3-5 branded keywords (company name + service terms)
- 1-2 service offering keywords
- GBP link if they are a local business

Step 2 — Review Existing Links
Use list_wildfire_links to check what community/cloud links already exist for this project. Identify gaps and avoid duplicating existing deployments.

Step 3 — Deploy Cloud Stack
Use deploy_wildfire_link to create web properties on cloud service providers. Target the branded keywords and service offering keywords provided by the user. Include the GBP link in the deployment if this is a local business.

Step 4 — Verify Deployment
Use list_wildfire_backlinks to confirm the deployed backlinks are active and pointing to the correct target URLs. Present a summary showing:
- Number of links deployed
- Target keywords used
- Cloud platforms deployed to
- Links pointing to main site vs GBP

Step 5 — Report
Summarize the authority signals created and expected impact timeline (typically 2-4 weeks for indexation and authority flow).
expected_benefits: Creates contextual backlinks on cloud service provider platforms
Builds authority at low cost with branded anchor text
Supports local SEO with GBP link inclusion

playbooks.name: Deploy Link Labs Guest Post Campaign
playbooks.description: Places editorial guest posts on topically relevant publishers through the Link Lab marketplace.
playbooks.instruction:
Deploy a guest post campaign through the Link Lab publisher marketplace.

Step 1 — Define Campaign Goals
Ask the user for:
- Target keywords and topics
- Budget range for guest post placements
- Preferred publisher categories (industry, niche)
- Target URL(s) to build links to

Step 2 — Discover Publishers
Use list_categories to browse the 900+ publication categories and find relevant ones. Use list (publications) to browse the publisher catalog with filters:
- Filter by category/niche relevance
- Filter by Domain Authority (DA) range
- Filter by traffic levels
- Filter by price range within budget

Use get_details to review specific publishers' metrics, editorial guidelines, and turnaround times.

Step 3 — Present Publisher Shortlist
Show the user 5-10 recommended publishers with:
- Publisher name and URL
- DA, traffic, and relevance metrics
- Price per placement
- Editorial requirements

Wait for user approval before proceeding.

Step 4 — Create Guest Post Article
Use create_article to write the guest post content. The article should:
- Be topically relevant to the publisher's audience
- Naturally incorporate the target keyword and link
- Meet the publisher's editorial guidelines
- Be high-quality editorial content, not advertorial

Use validate_content to verify the article meets placement requirements.

Step 5 — Place the Order
Use add_to_cart for each approved publisher. Use view_cart to review the complete order. Use checkout_cart to submit.

Step 6 — Track Progress
Use list (orders) and get_details to monitor order status. Report expected publication timelines to the user.
expected_benefits: Places editorial guest posts on topically relevant publisher sites
Builds high-quality backlinks from real publishers with real traffic
Provides full control over anchor text and target URLs

playbooks.name: Create Local Directory Citations
playbooks.description: Submits the user's business to local directory aggregator networks for citation building.
playbooks.instruction:
Create local directory citations for the user's Google Business Profile.

Step 1 — Pull GBP Data
Use list_locations to find the user's GBP locations. Use get_location to get full business details (name, address, phone, categories, hours, website).

Step 2 — Preview Citation Data
Use preview_citation_data to see what data will be submitted to directory networks. Verify NAP (Name, Address, Phone) consistency. Use get_citation_business_categories to check available categories and select the best match.

Step 3 — Review Existing Citations
Use get_aggregator_networks to check if any citations have already been submitted. Identify which aggregator networks still need submissions.

Step 4 — Submit Citations
Use submit_citation to send the business data to aggregator networks. These networks distribute to hundreds of local directories (Yelp, YellowPages, Foursquare, etc.).

Step 5 — Verify and Report
Use get_aggregator_details to check submission status for each network. Use export_citation to create a CSV record. Use bulk_refresh_stats to update citation statistics.

Present a summary showing:
- Number of networks submitted to
- Expected directory coverage
- Timeline for listings to appear (typically 2-8 weeks)
- NAP data submitted
expected_benefits: Distributes business data to hundreds of local directories via aggregator networks
Builds NAP consistency across the local citation ecosystem
Improves local search rankings through citation signals
playbooks.sample_prompt: Create local directory citations for my GBP

playbooks.name: Strengthen On-Page SEO for Priority Pages
playbooks.description: Identifies and deploys on-page SEO fixes for titles, meta descriptions, headings, and schema on priority pages.
playbooks.instruction:
Complete all pending OTTO SEO deployments and strengthen on-page SEO for priority pages.

Step 1 — Project Status Check
Use list_otto_projects to find the user's OTTO project. Use get_otto_project_details for full status. Use verify_otto_installation to confirm the OTTO pixel is active. If not engaged, use engage_otto_project.

Step 2 — Audit Current Issues
Use get_project_issues_summary to get a comprehensive view of all SEO issues. Use get_website_issues_by_type to break down issues by category:
- Title tags (missing, duplicate, too long/short)
- Meta descriptions (missing, duplicate, suboptimal)
- Headings (missing H1, improper hierarchy)
- Schema markup (missing or incomplete)
- Technical issues (broken links, redirect chains)

Step 3 — Generate AI Recommendations
For the highest-priority pages, use generate_bulk_recommendations to create AI-powered fix suggestions. Use export_suggestions to review all recommendations.

Step 4 — Review and Edit
Present the recommendations to the user organized by priority. Use edit_suggestions_bulk to modify any suggestions the user wants to adjust before deploying.

Step 5 — Deploy Fixes
After user approval, use deploy_seo_fixes for each issue type. Deploy in this order:
1. Title tags
2. Meta descriptions
3. Heading structure
4. Schema markup (use generate_page_level_schema and deploy_page_level_schema for pages, deploy_domain_level_schema for site-wide)

Use get_otto_task_status to monitor async deployments.

Step 6 — Verify and Recrawl
Use trigger_recrawl to force a fresh crawl after deployments. Present a before/after summary of changes deployed.

If any deployment needs to be reversed, use rollback_seo_fixes.
expected_benefits: Optimizes titles, meta descriptions, and headings on priority pages
Deploys schema markup for improved rich snippets
Improves visibility, relevance, and click-through rates

playbooks.name: Publisher Prospecting Outreach Playbook
playbooks.description: Creates and launches a publisher outreach campaign for editorial backlinks and media mentions.
playbooks.instruction:
Build and launch a publisher prospecting outreach campaign for editorial backlinks.

Step 1 — Verify Email Connection
Use list_linked_emails to confirm the user has a connected email account. If none exists, direct them to connect one at https://dashboard.searchatlas.com/outreach/campaigns before proceeding.

Step 2 — Create the Campaign
Use list_projects to check existing outreach projects. Use create_campaign with:
- Campaign name based on the user's industry and goal
- Target keywords journalists and publishers would search for
- Campaign type: publisher/editorial outreach

Configure with update_settings:
- 20-25 emails per day maximum
- Weekdays only (Monday-Friday)
- Business hours sending (9 AM - 5 PM recipient timezone)
- 3-day gap between follow-ups

Step 3 — Discover Opportunities
Use list (opportunities) to find relevant publishers. Filter for:
- Industry blogs and niche publications
- News sites accepting contributed content
- Minimum DA/DR threshold
- Exclude .gov sites, Fortune 500 corporate sites, and PBNs

Present the top 10-15 opportunities with key metrics (DR/DA, traffic, relevance). Wait for explicit user approval.

Step 4 — Create Email Templates
Use create (templates) to build personalized outreach templates. Focus on value exchange:
- Offer quality content, expert insights, or story ideas
- Reference specific articles on the publisher's site
- Keep it professional and concise
- Include a clear call-to-action

Create 2-3 template variations for A/B testing. Show templates to user for approval.

Step 5 — Schedule and Launch
Use schedule_bulk to queue outreach to approved opportunities. Use toggle_campaign to activate the campaign only after user gives explicit confirmation.

NEVER activate a campaign without explicit user approval.

Step 6 — Monitor
Use monitor_inbox to check for replies. Use get_email_thread and reply_to_email to manage conversations. Use manage_sent_items to track unreplied outreach.
expected_benefits: Builds journalist and publisher outreach campaigns
Secures high-quality editorial backlinks and media mentions
Maintains sender reputation with conservative sending limits

playbooks.name: Business Prospecting Outreach Playbook
playbooks.description: Creates a cold outreach campaign targeting local businesses with industry-specific SEO and AI search messaging.
playbooks.instruction:
Build and launch a local business prospecting outreach campaign.

Step 1 — Verify Email Connection
Use list_linked_emails to confirm the user has a connected email account. If none exists, direct them to connect one at https://dashboard.searchatlas.com/outreach/campaigns.

Step 2 — Define Target Audience
Ask the user for:
- Target industries or business types
- Geographic area(s) to target
- Company size preferences
- The user's service offering to pitch

Step 3 — Create the Campaign
Use create_campaign with a descriptive name. Configure with update_campaign:
- Target industry and location parameters
- Cold outreach type
- Professional B2B messaging tone

Set sending limits with update_settings:
- 15-20 emails per day (conservative for cold outreach)
- Weekdays only
- Business hours

Step 4 — Discover Prospects
Use list (opportunities) to find local business prospects matching the criteria. Present prospects with available metrics.

Step 5 — Build Email Templates
Use create (templates) with industry-specific messaging:
- Open with a specific observation about their business (website issue, missing from AI search results, competitor gap)
- Present the value proposition clearly
- Focus on SEO and AI search visibility as the hook
- Keep emails short (150-200 words)
- Include social proof if available
- Clear CTA (book a call, reply, visit a demo)

Create 2-3 variations. Show to user for approval.

Step 6 — Launch
Use schedule_bulk to queue approved prospects. Activate with toggle_campaign only after explicit user approval.

Step 7 — Manage Responses
Use monitor_inbox for incoming replies. Use reply_to_email for follow-ups. Track pipeline with manage_sent_items.
expected_benefits: Turns local business lists into complete cold outreach campaigns
Uses industry-specific messaging focused on SEO and AI visibility
Manages the full outreach pipeline from discovery to response
